p: An additional potential compound is mycophenolic acid (MPA), an antibiotic derived from penicillium fungal species ( PubChem, 2005b), which inhibited MERS-CoV replication in Vero cells with an EC 50 of 2.87 Î¼M ( Hart et al., 2014). However, MPA was not active against SARS-CoV in either in vitro or in vivo assay ( Barnard et al., 2006). The data suggested that MPA inhibits the enzyme IMP dehydrogenase, inducing apoptosis on alveolar macrophages and consequently inhibiting or suppressing cellular immune responses that are important for preventing or limiting viral infection ( Barnard et al., 2006).
